Project Description:
Leading international Bank focused on supporting individuals and companies to prosper in unique market footprint.
The services of Identity and Access Management (IAM) Division are fundamental in providing & controlling secure access to tools, while protecting information, needed by a wide variety of users across 70+
markets and territories, in which bank operates.
The Security Transformation initiative in IAM within the Bank will design, develop, deploy innovative tools and processes ensuring the compliance of the Bank with internal and external demands with regards to Identity (Password & session management, authentication services) and Access Managing (workforce and external users access grating, access identification, access controls and reporting) staying ahead of the curve in an ever changing security landscape.

The Data engineer will work collaboratively with various technology and business teams at group and regional levels to deliver changes optimizing the IAM risk posture with regards to Privileged Access Management, Authentication services, Access Management in a complex set of regional and group systems.

Responsibilities:

Being Client Focus: Ensuring the user stories are written with minimal ambiguity, and
proposed solutions, achieve the customers‚Äô goals

and proposing innovative, automated solutions where necessary.

‚Ä¢ Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing dataset, reports, and data performance indicators to locate
challenges and propose options for their remediation
‚Ä¢ Locate and define new data process improvement opportunities

programme and outside the programme.

Ability to work proactively, independently when necessary and displays strong initiative
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in business analysis
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant
amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience with data preparation tools, query acceleration tools and data visualisation tools such as DataIku, Dremio, Apache Arrow, Paxata, SAP, Tableau, MicroStrategy, Power BI
‚Ä¢ Good query knowledge: SQL/PLSQL/Hibernate SQL
‚Ä¢ Experience in working in multicultural teams

Nice-to-Have Skills:

‚Ä¢ Excellent problem-solving skills with a good standard of English (written and spoken) producing timely & accurate documents using the relevant business and industry specific technical language
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Python scripting and data wrangling development skills
‚Ä¢ Experience in end to end delivery of IAM systems from vendors such as SailPoint, BeyondTrust, Saviynt, Microsoft Active Directory, ForgeRock, Okta, AD etc

English: B2 Upper Intermediate

ITMAGINATION is looking for a talented Full-Stack Python Developers to participate in one of our up-and-coming projects.

Once you join our team you‚Äôll be able to shape innovative solutions in order to provide end-users with high-quality software and outstanding functionality using the newest technologies within supportive Scrum teams willing to share their knowledge.

Requirements

3+ years experience building and shipping scalable applications in Python
Track record of developing on backend frameworks such as Django Asyncio, Aiohttp, Flask, SQLAlchemy, or equivalent
Experience with Javascript (Nodejs, Reactjs)
Experience in a CI/CD pipeline
Experience working in a microservices architecture
At ease in the AWS ecosystem
Good English communication skills (spoken and written)

Benefits

Top Performers Bonus: earn a 13th salary based on clearly defined after engagement metrics
Highly competitive salary
Fully remote position
Possibility of 20 business days off in each year
Professional training programs ‚Äì including Udemy and other development plans
Work with a team that‚Äôs recognized for its excellence. We‚Äôve been featured in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & FT 1000 rankings. We‚Äôve also received the Great Place To Work¬Æ certification for four years in a row
Benefits package offer - Health Insurance, Sports Package, and Life Insurance offerings

The Role

We are seeking an experienced individual to join our Global Technology team as a Database Engineer. In this role, you work with a global engineering team to design, develop, and enhance database and ETL related code. You will support and refine database coding standards, and work with development teams to leverage them in practice. The ideal candidate would have deep technical expertise in ANSI SQL, ETL, and modelling development, possess strong organizational and collaboration skills, feel comfortable working across distributed teams worldwide.

What You‚Äôll Do
Work across a geographically split team to deliver global data solutions.
Manage development standards for database development (SQL and ETL)
Collaborate with other teams in enterprise level projects and provide support / guidance as needed
Develop key components/templates for offshore teams, evangelize and educate them

What You‚Äôll Bring
Expertise in ANSI SQL programming, particularly with SQL Server and Oracle
Expertise in ETL design and development, SSIS and Informatica are key
Performance tuning experience
Exposure to NoSQL and Graph programming
Strong attention to detail
Champion team success over individual accomplishment
Passionate about learning and continuous improvement

3+ years of prior technology leadership and development experience
Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to multitasking and quick learning.
Commitment to satisfying internal and external customers
Strong desire to win
Intellectual curiosity, and a can-do attitude

Neon is an open-source company on a mission to create a cloud-native Postgres database as a service for every developer. We are redefining the market category, and to make this happen we are looking for an outstanding Frontend Engineer who will contribute to the product roadmap and work on the development of a Postgres solution revolutionizing the database industry. You‚Äôll have the chance to work with a small, closely-knit team and make a big impact on our product and its users, many of whom work on jam stack applications. You will:
Make Neon‚Äôs applications better every day (web application for users, UI Kit, and some internal tools)
Collaborate with other team members to improve the product‚Äôs architecture and engineering practices
Design and implement new features so that our product can stay ahead of the market
Write clean, readable code to make it easier for your colleagues to conduct code reviews
Expand our footprint by interviewing and hiring great software engineers
Drive excellence through the team and implement the world's best practices

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has
Great track record of developing high-end applications using Javascript (4 years and more)
Experience with such technologies as React, Typescript, and Webpack
Strong fundamentals of Computer Science / Experience with backend
Experience with open-source projects and developing publicly is a plus
A motto to stay up to date with the newest trends in the world of web technologies
Attention to detail and great problem-solving skills
Passion for excellence, outstanding communication skills
Experience working in a fully remote global team
Fluency in English

About Us

Neon is building open-source cloud-native PostgreSQL. Our architecture separates storage from compute, allowing for stateless and serverless Postgres. We‚Äôre a well funded startup with deep knowledge of Postgres internals and decades of experience building databases. We are a systems company; we work on low-level code with strict performance and correctness requirements.

Neon was created by a team of Postgres hackers, and led by CEO Nikita Shamgunov (co-founder of SingleStore). Neon is built on open-source principles and is focused on giving back to the Postgres and developer communities.

Our Team
We are distributed team of 40 people working from 17 countries (North America, Europe, Middle East, Africa)
Team with decades of experience building databases and deep knowledge of Postgres internals
We have experienced Postgres hackers on the team (check Heikki , Anastasia , Arseny , Matthias )
We aim for a diversity of thoughts and backgrounds
We are keen to be a fast-moving flat org and avoid hierarchical structures

Our Investors
Top-tier investors backed up Neon's vision:
We raised $54.3m from GGV Capital, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst, Founders Fund
Our angels investors are prominent technologists, and ecosystem players. More than 20 awesome angels supported Neon, including Nat Friedman, Elad Gil, Mike Ovitz, Ajeet Singh, Guillermo Rauch, S√∏ren Brammer Schmidt, and Wes McKinney
Our Board includes Quentin Clark, Glenn Solomon, Joe Morrissey, and Leigh Marie Braswell

Our Offer
You have an opportunity to be an early employee in the fast-scaling ambitious team
You can work 100% remote: we'll handle all formalities to arrange work from your home
We pay top of the market in most parts of the world
We grant equity (stock options) for all full-time hires
We offer a competitive benefits package in line with all tech companies (top-notch equipment, unlimited vacations, paid parental leaves, and much more)
We are distributed, yet make our bonds during regular offsites (the last one was in Cyprus)

Description

Position at Premier Research

At Premier Research, we help biotech and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas into reality. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our staff members are the most valuable asset in delivering success. Inspiring and nurturing staff to do their best work means a better, healthier future for all. We‚Äôre a community of 2,000 people in more than 20 countries delivering unmatched expertise, operational skills, and dedication to meet the most challenging needs facing clinical trials today.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Management Reporting Programmer to join our Functional Services team that is passionate about improving healthcare through innovative clinical research. As a member of the Premier Research team, you‚Äôll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success.

What You Will Be Doing
Works with cross-functional study team members in a programming capacity to create reporting solutions that support the quality and timely delivery of data management reports and visualizations required per standard and study specific data review plans
Creates, enhances, and decommissions data management reports in accordance with applicable standard operating procedures
Ensures timelines and milestones are met in collaboration with cross functional teams
Creates any needed documentation for reports and ensures proper filing
Works across the portfolio to increase automated reporting (e.g. - JReview, Spotfire) and review in order to streamline effort on data intensive studies
Enhances available reporting tools or creates new ones to support the review of clinical trial data and trial status information for cross-functional use
Provides input on data management reporting standards as required
What We Are Searching For
Bachelor‚Äôs degree, or international equivalent from an accredited institution, preferably in a programming, technical, clinical, or health-related field, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
1 to 3 years of practical experience using commercial clinical data management systems (eg ‚Äì Oracle RDC / Inform, Medidata Rave, Datalabs, etc) or data visualization reporting tools (e.g. Spotfire, jReview). Alternatively, must have proven experience in all primary job functions
Practical experience with SQL or similar programming language required
Demonstrates excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including proficiency in the
Microsoft Office Suite of tools (eg - Outlook, Work, Excel, etc)
Proven ability to drive a successful customer experience through positive customer interactions, provision of quality and timely deliverables, and task ownership
Strong analytical and organization skills, able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
Why choose Premier Research?
Premier Research is more than a company ‚Äì it‚Äôs a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need.
Our cultural anchors ‚Äì Caring & Empathy, Empowerment, Aspiration, One Team ‚Äì mirror the flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location.
Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful.
Because we are transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments for a diverse population, we require the perspectives of a diverse staff thinking creatively, challenging ideas, and solving complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we create a community of belonging that welcomes differences, fuels innovation, and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve.

We hire people that add to our culture, then invest in developing skills and abilities. If you are excited about this role, but your past experiences do not perfectly align with the position as described, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be exactly the right candidate for this role or others.

Premier Research is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is compliant with all federal guidelines. All qualified applicants will receive equitable consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

About Andela

Andela exists to connect brilliance and opportunity. Since 2014, we have been dedicated to breaking down global barriers and accelerating the future of work for both technologists and organizations around the world.

For technologists, Andela offers competitive long term career opportunities with leading organizations, access to a global community of professionals, and education opportunities with leading technology providers.

For companies, Andela provides access to a global network of fully integrated team members that unlock their business‚Äô innovation and growth potential.

At Andela, we are deeply passionate about creating long-lasting and transformative growth opportunities for all and doing it in an E.P.I.C. [andela.com/careers] way.

We are excited to continue building our remote first team with incredible people like you!

About The Role

Andela is seeking to expand the SMB/Enterprise Matching Specialist team within Engineering Vertical that plays a critical role in the process of connecting our customers with the very best engineers in Andela‚Äôs talent network for their needs.

The team lies in the Talent Business Unit of Andela that is in charge of facilitating the entire journey of talents from top-of-the-funnel, sourcing, assessment, to matching them with clients and jobs, as well as community activities, and ensuring great talent experience in each step of the process.

The Matching Specialist Team Is Specifically In Charge Of Matching Clients/jobs And Talents From The Network Through a Number Of Activities Including

In this role, you will sit at the nexus of the Talent Unit and be the key link between the talents from the network and customers.

client-facing activities such as gathering, documenting, and communicating client requirements based on their business, technical, cultural, and resourcing needs
talent-facing activities such as searching, identifying, vetting, and placing the best qualified Andela engineer(s) to meet those needs.
a set of other activities that support the whole Matching process

Matching Specialist need to have a wide knowledge and some hands-on experience in technology and be up to date with all technologies, engineering concepts, and have an understanding of the engineering lifecycle in each area (e.g. full-stack, Data Engineering, DevOps, CloudOps, QA, etc) in order to be able and competent to discuss, and understand client‚Äôs needs, be able to advise on pros and cons of different solutions and give guidance on hiring strategies, as well as set the right expectations regarding feasibility, budget, timelines and turnaround times. You will also use this knowledge to properly search for talents (using our internal tools), and evaluate their suitability for the role, prep them and support them throughout the interview process.

In your day-to-day, you will be responsible for handling your portfolio of open jobs, pushing them through the funnel, updating all the systems with accurate information, and collaborating with many different teams in order to deliver on that.

This position requires a highly organized self-starter with an interest in operations, talent, and engineering. You must be comfortable and flexible navigating ambiguity and working across cross-cultural teams in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

Be responsible for the entire Matching Process from gathering requirements to placing an engineer on the job
Understand customer‚Äôs needs and be able to effectively craft and convey the best solution that fits their unique needs, including advising on likely resourcing strategies, expected timelines, and any talent-related constraints
Translate business and functional requirements from clients into documented technical specifications to aid in matching clients with the appropriate engineers
Own resourcing logistics and matchmaking, while providing insight into the process to relevant teams
Provide transparency on the availability of our engineers to revenue-driving teams and collaborate closely with recruiters to proactively bolster available talent with in-demand skills
When talent supply is unavailable, partner with recruiting team to strategize the best solution
Develop a deep understanding of engineers currently available, including their technical abilities, prior industry experience, and growth desires
Ensure 100% data accuracy in Andela‚Äôs systems around engineer profiles, availability, and engagements
Conduct informational and pre-vetting sessions with engineers concerning the placement and resourcing process
Perform activities related to supporting customer accounts, and engagements including preparation, onboarding, delivery management
Actively participate in driving growth to Andela‚Äôs network and customer accounts
Take part in creating and improving the team‚Äôs processes, policies, platform support
Maintain deep awareness of trends in software development and standard methodologies in distributed work

Preferred Qualifications

Four-year degree from an accredited university, preferably in Business, Operations, Engineering, or Computer Science
4+ years of experience working in software development, technology consulting, or technical product/project management
Understanding of the entire SDLC/ADLC in different areas of Technology
Familiarity with technology concepts including, but not limited to: cloud computing, mobile, applications design/development/hosting, DevOps, IoT, databases, analytics, machine learning, algorithms, networking, security, storage, continuous integration and deployment, APIs, microservices, containerization, and site reliability engineering
[For Ent team] 2+ years in Enterprise client-facing, operationally-focused role, ideally interacting with mid-to senior-level technology executives
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to optimally present sophisticated information clearly and keep track of multiple work streams at once
Experience directly interacting with customers and have a client-centric approach
Demonstrated ability to adapt to changing business priorities and a strong work ethic
Experience thriving in a fast-paced, collaborative, cross-disciplinary, and geographically dispersed environment
Strong organizational skills with experience coordinating multiple work streams simultaneously
Consistent track record to think out of the box, strategically and act tactically about business, customers, product, and technical challenges

#LI- NSR

Benefits

Fully Remote work culture - we hire globally and all of our roles are fully remote!
Bring your own device stipend - buy your own laptop with funds from Andela
Quarterly work from home stipends
Flexible working hours
Equity (as a part of compensation package)
Healthcare, 401k (US only)
Andela Affinity Groups
Growth & development paths
Generous Paid Time Off, Parental Leave, Compassionate Leave
And more to come! We're on a journey to reimagine global benefits at Andela

At Andela, we outcompete through diversity. We know that our strengths lie in the multiplicity of talents, perspectives, backgrounds & orientations resident in our community and we take pride in that. Andela is committed to a work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. Each individual has the right to work in a professional atmosphere that promotes equal employment opportunities and prohibits discriminatory practices. Andela provides equal employment opportunities and workplace to all employees and applicants without regard to factors including but not limited to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy (including breastfeeding), genetic information, HIV/AIDS or any other medical status, family or parental status, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This commitment applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Our policies expressly prohibit any form of harassment and/or discrimination as stated above.

Andela is home for all, come as you are.

At Picnic, we‚Äôre revolutionizing the way people buy groceries today with our innovative and sustainable modern milkman, app-only concept. We develop a whole new idea in-house, developing cutting-edge technologies and processes to ensure we continue to the rapid growth without missing a beat. If you're up for the challenge of taking Picnic from North Rhine-Westphalia across the whole Germany and help scaling up the modern milkman, then make sure you talk with us!

ü•ú In a nutshell

Did you know that...
we are a Dutch company founded in 2015 and active in The Netherlands, Germany and France, counting 1000+ talents in our central offices and more than 17 000 talents in operations across three countries?
we build 25+ tech products in-house and 20+ AI/ML projects like drop times optimization (read here), article demand forecast or personalization on the previously purchased articles?
we operate with a fleet of electric vehicles (read here), build most of our supply chain in-house (read here) and do only next-day delivery that allows us to set up a sustainable supply chain model?
we raised ‚Ç¨600M in our Series D round of funding to further build and grow the best milkman on earth?

The role of an In-house Analyst Consultant (listen to our colleagues' testimonials about their role here) at Picnic is versatile and changes based on your team and the projects you are involved in. We have more than 150 Analyst Consultants across all teams and you will be faced with a steep learning curve by working on complex projects, challenge the status-quo and impacting the business model cross-countries. Throughout the process we'll assess which domain suits you best: Commercial, Distribution, Fulfillment, Growth & Acquisition, Product, and Tech. You‚Äôll work with multiple stakeholders from our offices in the Netherlands, Germany, and France and work on optimizing the way we do things today at Picnic.

"I'm currently improving our pricing strategy in an ever changing market. This includes analyzing price differences across regions, stores and products to identify opportunities and work towards a more attractive, competitive and profitable assortment. My day mixes anything from meeting various stakeholders mostly from commercial team to complex analysis with Python, SQL, Tableau", Gertijn Kreijenbroek

üéØ What you‚Äôll do

You‚Äôll work on a wide range of exciting projects, which, depending on your team, can include:
Perform analyses on topics like: our store assortment and products ranking, fleet analytics and capacity modeling, mathematical optimization around our warehouse operations etc.
Develop algorithms and operating procedures to spot damaged products before they leave the warehouse
Demand forecasting: Develop forecasting models to predict future customer demand
Develop cost-benefit analyses to design a scalable cloud infrastructure that fits our automation projects
Onboarding program: Develop gifting and communication strategies to maximize engagement and retention of new customers
Determine the impact of improving our planning and routing algorithms in our supply-chain systems
. . . and many more projects!

Take a look at two of our projects in Strategy & Analytics: Picnic plays it cool: a data-driven cold chain for groceries and Finding Product Alternatives at Picnic!

‚≠ê About you
Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Robotics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Physics, Operational Research, Logistics & Supply Chain, or Business Engineering
0-2 years of work experience in a fast-paced environment or experience with projects involving data analytics, statistical modelling, machine learning, mathematical optimization or process simulation
Ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner to various stakeholders from different fields
Your communication skills allow you to convert abstract plans into digestible information for your team
You have worked with SQL and Python or are excited to learn
Your sharp business sense and conceptual thinking abilities mean you can look beyond the obvious to come up with fresh and innovative ideas

You're still wondering if this is the right role for you and you'd like to hear more about the role? Send an e-mail with your CV to our recruiter Lina ( lina.losse@teampicnic.com) and ask her for a short call together in order to get more insights before actually applying. (Please make sure that you fit the requirements in the "About you" section and that we can only count applications via the form below as valid).

üìñ Picnic Perks

Every expert was once a beginner!

You‚Äôll get plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself and grow, including the Picnic Tech Academy, Lunch & Learn sessions, and tailored soft skills training. We also offer free professional weekly language courses.

Make a difference

You‚Äôll work in an awesome scale-up environment with the freedom to drive your own projects and create a visible impact. Our fully electric vehicles and sustainable business model mean you‚Äôll also be contributing to making the world a better place!

Teamwork makes the dream work

With more than 80 nationalities across 3 countries, you‚Äôll be part of a diverse company with plenty of cool stuff to get involved with, from board game evenings to after-work drinks to our company ski trip and more!

You Are What You Eat

You‚Äôll get freshly prepared, healthy lunches, as well as snacks and drinks‚Äîenjoy!

Stay healthy

Mental health is important. As well as having the option to speak with Picnic colleagues who act as confidential advisors, our collaboration with OpenUp gives you easy access to professional psychologists, along with workshops and materials. There are plenty of sports communities and events to get involved with, from tennis to yoga to climbing!

Attractive package

We offer competitive compensation and a pension plan that looks out for your future self.

Work-life balance

Where possible, we like to enable people to work in ways that suit their working styles, which is why we have a hybrid-working model. Our teams generally like to have at least one team day per week at the office (the tasty lunch may be a factor), but besides that, it‚Äôs up to you and your team.

Benefits For Expats

It can be daunting starting a new job AND moving to a new country. That‚Äôs why we offer lots of support for our many expat colleagues, including:
Relocation package: If you join Picnic from abroad, we‚Äôll cover your trip to D√ºsseldorf, sponsor your Visa, and offer you a month of accommodation while you settle in (as long as regulations allow)
From health insurance to living arrangements to pet passports, there are always colleagues who‚Äôve faced the same challenges and are more than happy to help!

Commitment to equal opportunities

Picnic is an equal opportunity employer‚Äîthis means that all decisions regarding applications will be based on qualifications and merit. Applicants will be regarded independently of age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, skin color, civil status, religious beliefs, physical or mental disability, or any other factors protected by law.

At Picnic, we celebrate and value our differences and are committed to building a safe and inclusive working environment where everyone can be themselves.

location: Tudela, Chartered Community of Navarre, Spain
description:
Description

Guardian Industries, a global company headquartered in Auburn Hills, Michigan, employs more than 17,000 people and operates facilities throughout North America, Europe, South America, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. Guardian‚Äôs diverse group of companies are involved in the manufacture of high-performance float, coated and fabricated glass products and the manufacture of high-quality chrome-plated and painted plastic components for the automotive and commercial truck industries. Guardian‚Äôs vision is to create value for customers and society through constant innovation using fewer resources. Guardian is a wholly owned subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.

Guardian is looking for a Data Engineer (remote work) based in Spain or Poland.

Data Engineer is the subject matter expert on dimensional modeling techniques and data integration from external partners into transactional systems and through to the data warehousing and analytical platforms. The individual must be able to communicate in written form and manage workload dependencies. Strong analytical and problem solving skills are required.

What You Will Do In Your Role

Participate in analysis sessions to understand functional and non-functional requirements
Design DW tables base on dimensional modeling techniques (Kimball)
Create/develop code and jobs in Talend while following enterprise best practices
Provide technical insight and develop work estimates to project planners
Should be responsible for building extraction and mapping rules for loading data from multiple sources for data warehouse implementation based on AWS Snowflake
Must have strong knowledge on Data Warehousing (DWH) concepts, ETL concepts, data analysis capabilities and experience in the Talend Big-Data Real Time ETL tool.
Work with business users to translate requirements into system flows, data flows, data mappings etc., and develop solutions to complex business problems
Maintain workload and time tracking within Azure DevOps
Development experience working in Agile Scrum environment

Description

Backend Software Engineer

We‚Äôre looking for talented, friendly and experienced Software Engineers to help build our suite of customer facing products. Here in the Treatwell tech team we‚Äôre a nice bunch, we love to ship software and we like to think we‚Äôre pretty smart. We believe in Agile principles and values, our teams typically use Kanban and various XP practices, we love DDD and are using an event driven architecture to further decouple our applications and increase resilience. We like to use the right tech for the job but we don‚Äôt get seduced by the latest shiny fads. In this role, you will make a meaningful contribution in ensuring we make the right decisions.

You will be working on a variety of exciting technologies. Our application code is written in Java 11 using Spring Boot, Hibernate and Immutables. We use Redis for caching, Elasticsearch powers our venue searching and RabbitMQ is our message broker. Your application will be deployed within Docker containers and monitored using Prometheus. Everything runs in AWS.

You Will Be Responsible For

As a Software Engineer in the Treatwell team you will work as part of a cross functional Agile team writing and shipping high quality code frequently. You‚Äôll do whatever you can to help your team to meet or exceed its goals and you will drive incremental improvements in both the way we work and the software we deliver. You will also help your teammates to become more effective and grow their skills.

We do things well, but we‚Äôre not complacent. We want to do great work and to be known for it. We are breaking up our applications into microservices that are well tested, independently deployable and highly observable. We are empowering our teams to operate independently and to ship to production as frequently as they see fit. We‚Äôre looking for people who can help us to realise this vision and accelerate the journey, who know what great technology looks like and who can mentor our existing team.

About You
You‚Äôve written Java professionally.
You‚Äôve worked with some of our tech stack and can learn the rest very quickly.
You‚Äôve been part of a high-performing, autonomous Agile development team who deliver continuously.
You get a kick out of mentoring and empowering the team around you.
You have a deep understanding of how distributed applications are designed and built.
You know good technical design when you see it and how to ensure quality is embedded in the software development process.
You‚Äôre a good communicator, fun to work with and enjoy being part of a vocal, passionate team.
You‚Äôre active in the software development community, whether through blogs, meetups, personal projects or open source contributions.

About Treatwell

Hi, we‚Äôre Treatwell. Nice to meet you.

We‚Äôre a team of 800 (and growing) passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe. We‚Äôre the industry‚Äôs smartest salon management software, all connected to Europe‚Äôs leading booking platform, working with over 50,000 salon partners across 13 countries and processing over 8 million bookings every month. And‚Ä¶.breathe.

But we‚Äôre not done yet. We‚Äôre on an exciting journey to digitally revolutionise the hair and beauty community.

If this excites you, we might have just the role for you.

We‚Äôll Treat You With
28-days holiday, plus bank holidays
Monthly 40 EUR Treatwell vouchers so you can treat yourself too
Growth funds for you to develop and grow with your team
A discount for gym membership
100% remote position with flexible working
Annual Treatwell retreat to a sunny European destination
All the tools / devices supplied to do the best job you can eg. laptop, monitor, keyboard, etc

Equal Ops

Treatwell is an ‚ÄòOpen to All‚Äô employer and warmly welcomes everybody to the team. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application.

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Our Technology team isn‚Äôt just one of the best in the industry, it‚Äôs one of the best in the world. And we‚Äôre proud of it. It‚Äôs our driving force; our engine üöÄ

From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there‚Äôs nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can‚Äôt do.

Our Technology team isn‚Äôt here to fix legacy systems ‚Äì it‚Äôs here to build world-class financial products from the ground up.

Products that will be used by millions of people around the world üåé

You may expect our Python Engineers to work on heavily regulated banking systems, but we love the unexpected.

We‚Äôre actually better known internally for writing high-quality code and building complex novel solutions end-to-end üß†

These geniuses have created our chatbot ‚Äì the lovely Rita ‚Äì and they didn‚Äôt stop there ü§Ø

They‚Äôve also created automated FinCrime quality controls in a few weeks. Yes, they‚Äôre just that good!

You‚Äôll never work alone, either. As a Python Engineer, you‚Äôll sit within a Product Team ‚Äì simultaneously working with Data Scientists, Analysts, Engineers, Product Owners and Operations Managers to solve problems and make our rocket ship fly even higher üöÄ

Ready to join? üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Building APIs making sure they are properly designed and scale according to the business needs
Creating data pipelines to pull data from production services into our data warehouse - powering reporting, data analytics and data science
Writing event consumers to build new data models in order to provide this data to new flows and processes

What You'll Need
5+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer
3+ years Engineering with Python as your primary language
An academic background in a STEM subject
Fluency in Python, SQL and other OOPLs
Experience with API development & integration
Practical understanding of distributed systems
Ability to write concurrent code in IO/CPU bound situations
Experience with Docker, K8s, Ansible, Teamcity, monitoring and alerting

Nice to have
Experience with prototyping and sketching
Multiple side projects or open source contributions
Exposure to GCP
Experience with Django Framework

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Skills

LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a leading customer engagement company, creating digital experiences powered by Curiously Human AI. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.

You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself.

Overview

LivePerson is growing fast, and we want our technology to keep up. We've formed a team that evolves our database and data storage systems and how they're used by application teams so we can scale faster than ever before. We're looking for a Database Engineer to help define how we accomplish this goal, and to help us achieve it.

You Will
Understand the design and architecture of new and fault-tolerant cloud-based databases and how we redesign existing systems
Participate and collaborate with the team taking ownership of the most parts of solutions and create bar-raising solutions
Investigate hard-to-pin-down problems across a complex and distributed architecture so you can explain root causes and propose solutions
Make a case for how we stay ahead of capacity issues and limit the blast radius of issues when a cluster is stressed
Work with database clients to improve their use of databases (e.g. queries optimization, evolve data models)
Advocate for solutions that help teams launch quality software without compromising delivery speed
You Have
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent training or work experience
5+ years of experience building successful production software systems
Experience configuring any of the following database systems: MySQL, Cassandra, Couchbase, Elasticsearch, NoSQL
Experience configuring and administering BI database system like Vertica is ideal
Experience managing database systems in a hybrid cloud
Familiarity with distributed event streaming platforms, especially Kafka
Familiarity creating architectures that scale with volume and are fault-tolerant
Experience with distributed persistent systems & asynchronous messaging
Experience tuning distributed systems to improve their performance under increasing volumes of traffic
Experience working in a fully remote environment with people across the globe
Relevant certifications is plus (e.g AWS Certification, Google Cloud Platform Certification)
Benefits
Health: medical, dental, and vision
Development: Native AI learning
Why You'll Love Working Here

Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces.

Belonging At LivePerson

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

The Role

We are looking for a virtual PMO Group Leader that will be part of the management team of the Solera Global Project Management Office (PMO) and lead a team of project management professionals that will specifically have a focus on projects related to products that Solera markets to its clientele internationally (i.e., outside of North America). The team that this individual will manage may act in traditional project and portfolio management roles and will be comprised of individual of varying levels of experience and seniority in this field. The projects that they will manage will consist largely of technology projects that include a heavy emphasis on all aspects of a software development lifecycle in an agile development environment. In this role, the PMO Group Leader will be responsible for assignment of staff to projects requiring PMO support at any given time, and as such providing the best match of skillsets within the team with the needs of each project and balancing workloads of the team to optimize utilization of staff. In addition, the PMO Group Leader will establish a hierarchical project management structure that will facilitate multiple levels of project status reporting and issue escalation including, at minimum, project, portfolio, and group level. As such it is critical that the PMO Group Leader is highly skilled, experienced, and competent in acting in a group-level oversight role of multiple project portfolios and thus can act in an effective role of oversight, advisement, selective intervention to assist in issue resolution where needed, and as a final point of escalation of issues within the group to attempt to resolve with escalation further up the management chain only on rare occasion when necessary. These job requirements necessitate an individual with several years of successful hand-on experience in managing projects consisting of varying business needs, technologies, stakeholders, levels of complexity, and problem-solving. The PMO Group Leader will require a history of competency and accomplishment in the exact roles of the team members, as they will depend on their manager for expert-level guidance, direction, advisement, and support in successfully managing their own projects. The PMO Group Leader‚Äôs overall mission is to manage a group that consistently demonstrates and is reputable in an ability to deliver critical projects of various types, meeting business expectations, and most importantly successfully delivering the intended and expected results, with solid communication and transparency every step of the way.

What You‚Äôll Do
Assume administrative leadership of a group of project management professionals
Drive standard processes, tool usage, and best practices for consistency and reliability of project delivery from group that conforms to corporate-level standards that are propagated globally across Solera
Be part of a PMO management team that is charged with competency, consistency, precision, & success of project delivery on a global scale across Solera
Be able to speak in a thorough, substantive, and accurate manner about the projects under the group‚Äôs management responsibility and serve as an effective point of communication of status, as well as escalation of issues to leadership outside the group as needed
Act as an effective backstop for issue resolution and problem-solving related to projects under management responsibility of the group, ensuring that escalations beyond the group on only on rare occasion ‚Äì the PMO Group Leader should be able to advise, direct, and assist as needed to resolve the majority of issues that are raised for any given project
Collaborate with other PMO leadership to formulate new processes, reengineer existing ones, as well as define and propagate best practices and standard procedures related to project management across Solera
Collaborate with other PMO leadership as needed to establish an effective management model for PMO resource sharing and cross-utilization, as well as resource accountability not only to their direct manager but also a dotted line to their stakeholders (e.g., portfolio managers, product managers, etc.)
Act as a point of escalation for stakeholders regarding any projects within the management responsibility of the group
Serve in administrative management capacity to team members, collaborating and advising them in career planning and management, as well as performance evaluations, and recognition of accomplishments

What You‚Äôll Bring
Bachelor's degree (BS/BA) in a related field of study; Masters in a related field is a plus
10+ years experience of project, program, and project portfolio management experience, particularly in software and information technology in a wide breadth of size & complexity
5+ years experience in the design & definition of project management processes, procedures, and standard practices for an organization
5+ years experience in an agile development environment
5+ years of industry-standard tool usage related to project management and agile development
PMP Certification preferred; agile methodology certification is a plus

Demonstrated ability to:
Be results driven ‚Äì period ‚Äì and manage your team to be the same
Communicate effectively and transparently in a clear and concise manner with colleagues, direct reports, and all levels of management
Be collaborative in nature with employees, management peers, customers, stakeholders, and all levels of management
Be oriented toward making clear agreements in every aspect of the job, with employees, management, peers, and stakeholders
Create structure where this is none and articulate and establish it in an effective manner so it is recognized and adopted
Lead the team and teach them how to effectively lead ‚Äì not chase ‚Äì their projects
Base decisions and judgments strictly on facts ‚Äì not conjecture, supposition, or hearsay ‚Äì and perform the legwork to get the facts needed for every situation
Resolve conflict or disagreement among team members, peers, management, stakeholders in a respectful fashion and with the perspectives in mind of not just yourself but of all those involved
Be proactive in problem-solving; treating risk management as the key to minimal problems, obstacles, & blockers that can occur in project execution and teach the team to think and to act in that fashion and modeling the behavior for them
Be accountable, trustworthy, direct, and objective in fulfillment of job expectations, deliverables, performance, and results of the team that they are in charge of
Be able to operate and thrive in an environment that is challenging and can change frequently with aggressive objectives to meet and complex problems to overcome
Manage employees in a fair, consistent, transparent, objective, and constructive fashion, with a genuine interest and investment in their success and career growth, as well as the benefit of your years of experience and insight
Be process oriented and recognize the importance of standardization for repeatability, consistency, and maturity of our project management capabilities across the organization
Be calm and collected under pressure, and as a result keep your employees also calm and collected
Be a team player and have the company‚Äôs and its employees success as the main underlying goal driving your actions and leadership

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Revolut Technology team isn‚Äôt just one of the best in the industry, it‚Äôs one of the best in the world. And we‚Äôre proud of it. It‚Äôs our driving force; our engine üöÄ

From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there‚Äôs nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can‚Äôt do.

Our Technology team isn‚Äôt here to fix legacy systems ‚Äì it‚Äôs here to build world-class financial products from the ground up.

Products that will be used by millions of people around the world üåé

You may expect our Python Engineers to work on heavily regulated banking systems, but we love the unexpected.

We‚Äôre actually better known internally for writing high-quality code and building complex novel solutions end-to-end üß† Revolut People platform is the engine behind Revolut‚Äôs historic growth from 2,000 employees in 2020 to over 5,000 employees in 2022. However, we‚Äôre not stopping there. Driving Revolut‚Äôs hyper-growth was only a proving ground for what‚Äôs to come.

Now embarking on a journey to create a revolutionary HCM tool for companies globally ‚Äìand for this to happen we need a superstar Engineer. A real Python MVP, who‚Äôll help us to build the next generation employee management tool.

If you‚Äôre passionate about creating reliable and exclusive software, while deepening your knowledge on the next HR SaaS disruptor - you know what to do! üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Creating new features using Python and Django to transform old school people processes into something user-friendly and purely digital
Writing scalable and easily maintainable code following the highest standards agreed in the community
Supporting multi-tenancy (ie multiple customers) while ensuring adequate security and data isolation
Refactoring and optimising existing implementation

Promoting a culture of product quality ‚Äî identifying bugs and issues before our users do

We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.

This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.

In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.

You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.

You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.

You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.

What you will do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc).
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors
Nice to have / optional:
Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects
We offer
Learning and Development opportunities and budget
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority pass for travel
Flexible working option

Job Description

Project Managers are the primary point of contact for our clients from project initiation through to closeout. The Project Manager is responsible for ensuring that projects are carried out to the best possible standards, within relevant timelines, at an acceptable cost and in line with overall company objectives, while meeting client requirements for deliverables. They are responsible for setting and meeting client expectations and communicating project progress to all the stakeholders in the project ‚Äì the client, sales and the operations team.

Remote, work from home opportunity! Monday through Friday, regular business hours.

Responsibilities

Provide exceptional service.
Work with sales to help plan projects and ensure they are scoped in a cost effective manner.
Attend transition/kick-off calls.
Oversee status calls with clients and internal resources.
Take responsibility for all aspects of an individual project once the contract is agreed.
Deliver projects on time and to budget, and to client satisfaction.
Provide pricing input related to any project requirements.
Provide project specific reporting as required by the client and internal stakeholders.
Develop relationships with appropriate client representatives.
Work with the Project Office Team to ensure that project documentation is maintained.
Ensure that project knowledge is shared with other members of the team
Ensure all project financials are appropriately managed, forecasted and invoiced.

Further role Duties

Essential Function: Successfully manage complex concurrent projects from project win to completion.
Desired Result: Deliver projects which meet or exceed client expectations.
Essential Function: Provide complete and timely communications to KLDiscovery clients ensuring that at all levels of the client organisation, the project status is understood.
Desired Result: Client expectations are understood by KLDiscovery and the client has an appropriate understanding of project status and futures.
Essential Function: Provide appropriate work direction to all internal KLDiscovery personnel assigned to execute the project.
Desired Result: KLDiscovery staff can deliver projects which meet or exceed client expectations.
Essential Function: Act as a liaison between internal KLDiscovery personnel and KLDiscovery‚Äôs client to facilitate successful project completion.
Desired Result: Information is accurately communicated in a manner that each party can understand.
Essential Function: Facilitate project meetings and internal communication between KLDiscovery staff to ensure projects are completed correctly and on time.
Desired Result: Takes ownership and ensures timely completion of action items to maintain project schedule.
Essential Function: Carry out all appropriate processes and procedures to ensure correct forecasting of revenue and invoicing of client project.
Desired Result: Correct financial forecast and invoices are made to the appropriate stakeholders.

Experience

Significant project management experience within Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) where this has involved extension and ongoing liaison (face to face, phone and email) with external clients.
Hands on experience with RELATIVITY e-Discovery review platform.
Proven ability to lead multiple projects and multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Must have previous experience of facilitating meetings and following complex/detailed processes.
Legal/industry knowledge or experience is essential.
High degree of interpersonal sensitivity to allow building of relationships with experienced, qualified staff and clients.
Solid written and verbal communication skills ‚Äì ability to communicate with individuals at all levels.
Strong ability to work autonomously; identifies and presents solutions; confident decision making ability.
Strong attention to detail.
Technical aptitude and financial appreciation.
Ability to work effectively within a team environment.
Degree or equivalent qualification preferred.
Fluent English is required. Fluency in French would be highly advantageous

What We Offer

A friendly and welcoming team-oriented environment
Opportunities for career advancement and growth
Paid benefits

KLDiscovery Culture

We Seek Team Members Who Are

Entrepreneurs at heart, we are a customer first team sharing one goal and one vision.

Humble - No one is above another; we all work together to meet our clients‚Äô needs and we acknowledge our own weaknesses;
Hungry - We all are driven internally to be successful and to continually expand our contribution and impact;
Smart - We use emotional intelligence when working with one another and with clients.

Our culture shapes our actions, our products, and the relationships we forge with our customers. It helps us stand out in an ever-increasing crowd of providers. It is special and it is unique. It is KLDiscovery.

Company Overview

KLDiscovery provides technology-driven services and software to help legal, corporate and government entities preserve, collect, search, analyse, review and produce data to meet legal needs efficiently and cost-effectively. For more information about the Legal Technologies business at KLDiscovery in Europe please visit www.kldiscovery.com

industry: Retail Health and Personal Care Products
description:
PromoFarma by DocMorris integrates the catalog of more than 1.000 pharmacies and health/beauty stores off-line pharmacies in a single website. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

We want to incorporate a CRM Automation Specialist for the Marketing Team. You will be involved in the development of initiatives that will contribute improve the purchase repetition and customer loyalty. Working closely with designers, developers, and project managers this role will implement all programmatic and operational initiatives through our marketing automation platform.

Tasks:

Implement Marketing Automation Journeys - with emails, sms and push notifications- accoding to buyer persona, RFM and the customer journey step of the user.
Develope with our Data team highly personalized automated content blocs to increase the relevance of our communications.
Support the CRM designer with the development of fully responsive quality front-end code -CSS/HTML- for emails and workflows, including templates with personalized content, with an eye toward performance/UX, accessibility, and industry best-practices
Work together with our Data team to ensure that relevant targeting data structure is maintained on both Salesforce and Eulerian tools.
Work together with our ENG team on the post-sale experience B2B & B2C implementing triggers based on sales status
Help the CRM team to analyze campaign results, cohorts evolution and develop key performance indicators

Requirements:

Expertise in Html/CSS, and experience with Server-Side JavaScript or other scripting languages is a plus
Competency in SQL: queries, and understanding of data models/relationships
Advanced Skills in CRM Systems and technologies (Salesforce Marketing Cloud is a plus)
Open to collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to understand business needs and identify opportunities for new or enhancing existing initiatives.
Attitude open to act as a technical liaison with Design, ENG and Data Teams, with capacity to participate and reach consensus between teams
Responsible person, resolute and oriented to continuous improvement

What we offer:
Great opportunity to join a young, innovative and proactive team, creating an exceptional work environment. Remote working is possible and also we have a beautiful office in Barcelona Diagonal/Aribau, where you can find a flexible working space with coffee and tea!

Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked.
Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport, or Nursery.
Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by the company for those who want it!
Gympass
25 days of holidays
Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
Flexible schedules. Free Friday afternoon.

More about us
Zur Rose Group is the leading European ePharmacy, with 2 Billion Euros in revenue and +12 Million active customers. We are the leading pharmacy e-commerce in our core markets operating under different brands (Docmorris, Promofarma, Medpex, Eurapon, etc.), selling health, beauty, and personal care products combining different set-ups (mail-order pharmacies, marketplaces, etc.) as well as offering digital health services such as telemedicine under the Teleclinic brand.
The group is composed of 3 major segments: Europe, Switzerland, and Germany. We are the Europe segment which includes Spain, France, and Portugal.

With an innovative business model, our marketplace does not manage stock or warehouses, it integrates the catalog of products, pricing, and stock levels of the most important and trusted off-line pharmacies in a single website, achieving 24h delivery service for more than 200.000 products and 10.000 brands from more than 1.000 pharmacies and health stores. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

Be part of our E-Health journey, just send us your application!

Job Requisition ID: 6303

Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.

General Information

We - the Data Science Solutions Unit at SCHAEFFLER are looking for you! We create user-centric digital solutions that we also use internationally. In doing so, we use one of the most important assets of our company: data!

We - that are several agile teams consisting of colleagues from all over the world with the highest expertise in the areas of data science, artificial intelligence & machine learning, holistic user experience, cloud computing & software engineering, integration & architecture.

Award-winning applications speak for our success.

We are also happy to receive applications from interested Young Professionals (m/f/d).

Your Key Responsibilities
Create, deploy and operate Data Science Solutions in the context of machine lifetime analysis as part of a cross-functional, agile product team
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders and condition monitoring specialists
Carry out time series data analyses for the prediction of machine states
Research scientific papers and apply relevant techniques to industry problems along with thorough validation of results
Become a fully-committed member of a product team which takes ownership of new AI services from literature research to model serving
Become an active part of our strong Data Science Solutions department where exchange and networking beyond team borders is a welcome source of inspiration

Your Qualifications
Completed degree in (business) informatics, mathematics or comparable qualification
Ideally some years of professional experience in the field of statistics, vibration analysis and time series analysis, gladly acquired through relevant internships
Knowledge of signal processing, hypothesis testing, Bayesian modelling, lifetime analysis
Sound knowledge of Python and relevant libraries (e. g. pandas, numpy, tf , statsmodel, scipy, scikit-learn)
Understanding of basic programming principles and modern DevOps Tooling are required e. g. SQL, Git, Docker, Jenkins
First experience in the creation, deployment and operation of AI services, ideally in an API-first approach
Experience with running machine learning experiments on the cloud and using AzureML services for results and artefacts traceability would be preferred, also usage of Azure Synapse analytics is plus
Past experience with big data analyses will be an advantage, ideally in the context of condition monitoring
Knowledge of NLP methods is a plus as well as of model maintenance (data drift/ model drift) in production would be helpful
Very good knowledge of spoken and written English, German is a plus
Open to new cloud technologies and data science methods and continuously striving to improve
Distinct analytical competence, ability to concentrate and communication skills paired with an agile and product-oriented mindset

As a global company with employees around the world, it is important to us that we treat each other with respect and value all ideas and perspectives. By appreciating our differences, we inspire creativity and drive innovation. In this way, we contribute to sustainable value creation for our stakeholders and society as a whole. Together, we advance how the world moves.

Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your online application.

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

About the opportunity:

Frontiers catalog is growing. Every month we need to handle more journals, articles, and research topics, to process more data and enable new features for our users.

We are looking for a Data Scientist (Graph) Team Lead with experience leading teams, to join our business and manage a Data Team formed by Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

You will define, plan and coordinate internal technical projects related to our Data Products. The development and evolution of knowledge graphs, and the creation of a solid data foundation to empower our data scientists and our machine learning team.

Key Responsibilities
Lead, coach and evolve your team, creating a culture of excellence that will allow them professional growth.
Plan and coordinate the activities for the creation of data products and features that extract value from data in our different systems.
Lead the work in a complex data-intensive environment, handle the integration with systems built by other teams.
Map business and technical requirements into actionable initiatives, reporting and analyzing results in a timely manner, and learning from any mistakes
Work close to the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team, to help them to extract the maximum value and empower their initiatives.
Collaborate with other leaders to identify and capitalize on opportunities to leverage new technologies and create novel solutions to our organizations challenges.

What we are looking for:
Minimum 5 years experience as a Senior Data Scientist or Senior Data Engineer with at least 3 years leading teams
A natural leader, proactive and hands-on
Comfortable handling uncertainty in evolving scenarios who can understand priorities and balance them
Strong knowledge of current industry-wide Data Engineering and DS/ML practices, tools, and techniques
Our technical stack is based on GCP, Google BigQuery, Kafka, Databricks, PySpark, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch and therefore knowledge on any of these would be highly beneficial
These are some of the data challenges we are working on and therefore any experience with these would be beneficial:
Knowledge of Neo4j
Knowledge of Cypher queries
Experience working with knowledge graph
Familiarity with Agile framework
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination ‚Äì including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

‚Ä¢ Perform various duties related to software quality assurance, function testing, performance testing

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with global RD and operations team to verify bug fix and recreate issues from user feedbackJob Position Description:

The Company

Cover Genius is a Series D insurtech that protects the global customers of the world‚Äôs largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com , Intuit, Hopper, Skyscanner, Ryanair, Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We‚Äôre also available at Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Wayfair and SE Asia‚Äôs largest company, Shopee. Our partners integrate with XCover, our award-winning insurance distribution platform, to embed protection for millions of customers worldwide each year.

Our team and products have been recognised with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times which ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest-growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 20+ countries and many language groups commit itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular, ‚ÄúCG Gives‚Äù which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities.

Our People are

Bold, Authentic, Purposeful, and Inspired

Our People are not

Perfect, Traditional, Complacent, or Cautious

About The Role

Your role as a Software Engineer will be to work on the development of our new fraud detection system, using the latest versions of PHP (Laravel) and other technologies required by the specific fraud case. This position will be mainly back-end focused, but full-stack approach and moderate knowledge of modern frontend frameworks is a must. You will be part of very exciting developments, such as implementation of various AI driven sets of fraud detection checks, integrations of external and internal REST APIs and continually enhancing the product's features and performance using an Agile (Scrum) development framework.

You should be located within Spain, preferably Malaga (Andalucia).

What you will be doing:

Collaborate with Product and Engineers within the team to identify the needs of our stakeholders and implement the next generation of products that meet these needs
Architect, build, and test new powerful mechanism for fraud detection
Actively problem solve by collaborating with other engineers and product managers to implement versatile solutions to complex needs
Driving the development and taking full ownership of projects from design to implementation
Work with a small team of engineers to maintain excellent coding standards and practices
Provide all-around coding expertise to constantly enhance the potential of the system
Constantly on the lookout for enhancing the system by staying up-to-date with current best-practices

What does the ideal profile looks like:

3+ years commercial experience with PHP web frameworks (preferably with Laravel)
Experience with JavaScript frameworks (such as Vue, React)
Experience building APIs (ideally, highly scalable, low-latency)
Big plus if you had experience working with big data and algorithms
Experience with testing frameworks and practices
Familiarity with performance debugging and bench-marking Ideally, experience contributing to open source projects
