Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

The Application Analyst provides technical support aligned with a specific product vertical to a mix of technical and non-technical customers by diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing and debugging complex software and/or networked systems. You will have frequent phone and email interaction with our customers and require the development of in-depth technical product, SQL, network and server knowledge and exceptional customer service skills.

On a daily basis, the Application Analyst creates, resolves, and maintains tickets, while working within their product vertical to resolve issues and escalate tickets to other teams and verticals. It is essential that the Application Analyst maintains accurate records of all activities and interactions in Salesforce and responds to clients within identified service level agreements. You will inform management of important issues regarding personnel, performance, client perception, and project statuses, and work with colleagues to ensure quality service. This role will report to the Manager of Customer Support. The working hours are based on rotational shifts, (including nights, weekends, and public holidays), where shifts rotate or change according to a set schedule published in advance

Your Role in Action: Technical Skills/Responsibilities

Use SQL applications and tools to run basic SQL queries
Respond to client questions, problems, and work requests on a daily basis
Develop an expertise in company products and services and the initiative to take an active role in sharing this knowledge with customers
Partner with senior level team members as needed to troubleshoot and resolve customer incidents
Have or develop the experience to capably perform the Application Analyst position responsibilities

Policy And Procedure Skills

Follow appropriate procedures for creating, categorizing, updating, escalating, transitioning, and resolving tickets. Attention to proper detail when coding and documenting tickets is essential for accurate reporting and maintaining historical ticket data
Monitor assigned open tickets, contact customers, and update tickets on a timely basis
Provide responsive support to clients during normal shift hours, when scheduled for early and late shifts, and as identified for on-call or as requested by management. Early/Late shifts and on-call could be required of the qualified Application Analyst staff
Complete all daily tasks and projects
Track time daily

Expectations of the Role

Provide excellent customer service using the communication methods designated by Relativity
Is flexible to work rotational shifts (including nights, weekends, and public holidays), where shifts rotate or change according to a set schedule published in advance
Demonstrate initiative to learn new skills, such as SQL applications and tools to run basic SQL queries
Meet identified goals regarding customer service tech support metrics
Commitment to and consistent demonstration of core company values

Your Skills

Customer support experience
Client-focused and ability to understand expectations
Direct experience supporting clients as a primary contact or lead using phone and email
Experience troubleshooting complex issues
SQL and Windows platform experience

The Application Analyst provides technical support aligned with a specific product vertical to a mix of technical and non-technical customers by diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing and debugging complex software and/or networked systems. You will have frequent phone and email interaction with our customers and require the development of in-depth technical product, SQL, network and server knowledge and exceptional customer service skills.

On a daily basis, the Application Analyst creates, resolves, and maintains tickets, while working within their product vertical to resolve issues and escalate tickets to other teams and verticals. It is essential that the Application Analyst maintains accurate records of all activities and interactions in Salesforce and responds to clients within identified service level agreements. You will inform management of important issues regarding personnel, performance, client perception, and project statuses, and work with colleagues to ensure quality service. This role will report to the Manager of Customer Support. The working hours are based on rotational shifts, (including nights, weekends, and public holidays), where shifts rotate or change according to a set schedule published in advance

Your Role in Action: Technical Skills/Responsibilities

Use SQL applications and tools to run basic SQL queries
Respond to client questions, problems, and work requests on a daily basis
Develop an expertise in company products and services and the initiative to take an active role in sharing this knowledge with customers
Partner with senior level team members as needed to troubleshoot and resolve customer incidents
Have or develop the experience to capably perform the Application Analyst position responsibilities

Policy And Procedure Skills

Follow appropriate procedures for creating, categorizing, updating, escalating, transitioning, and resolving tickets. Attention to proper detail when coding and documenting tickets is essential for accurate reporting and maintaining historical ticket data
Monitor assigned open tickets, contact customers, and update tickets on a timely basis
Provide responsive support to clients during normal shift hours, when scheduled for early and late shifts, and as identified for on-call or as requested by management. Early/Late shifts and on-call could be required of the qualified Application Analyst staff
Complete all daily tasks and projects
Track time daily

Expectations of the Role

Provide excellent customer service using the communication methods designated by Relativity
Is flexible to work rotational shifts (including nights, weekends, and public holidays), where shifts rotate or change according to a set schedule published in advance
Demonstrate initiative to learn new skills, such as SQL applications and tools to run basic SQL queries
Meet identified goals regarding customer service tech support metrics
Commitment to and consistent demonstration of core company values

Your Skills

Customer support experience
Client-focused and ability to understand expectations
Direct experience supporting clients as a primary contact or lead using phone and email
Experience troubleshooting complex issues
SQL and Windows platform experience
Travel 10% of the time

The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.

This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.

In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.

You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.

You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.

You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.

What you will do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc).
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors
Nice to have / optional:
Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects
We offer
Learning and Development opportunities and budget
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority pass for travel
Flexible working option

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

What You Will Do

Is Azure your top environment? Are you delivering PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions? Join our international team, and support Azure Data Lake now and Azure Snowflake in the future!

How You Will Do It
Proactive administration & support of Azure Data Lake Platform including admin, incident management & troubleshooting
Be the point of contact for Azure PaaS services including Data Factory, ADLS, Databricks, Synapse & DevOps ‚Äì Capacity/Cost tracking
Support & Maintain ‚Äì Big Data Cluster ‚Äì based on HD Insight, Azure Synapse & Hive
Define standards & best methodologies with Technical Architects & ensure they are implemented or maintained
Liaise with Microsoft Support & SMEs in the escalation & resolution of platform issues
Collaborate with partners of all levels to coordinate, maintain & support Data platforms along with ETL Jobs using Azure Data Factory (ADF)
Design & implement solutions in the Azure cloud platform & related technologies for various enterprise applications
Build solutions to monitor, trace, log & address any concerns in cloud-based data platform architecture
Required

What we look for
3+ years hands-on experience using various methodologies to deliver robust PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions using Azure Cloud technologies
Database technologies i.e. Azure SQL and Azure HD Insight
Overview of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Snowflake, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Security Management with Ranger policies
PowerShell or other scripting languages
Technical troubleshooting, log analysis & performance optimization experience
Preferred

The expertise of Azure cloud-based data platform architecture
Expertise in Big data platforms, HIVE & Enterprise data platform
Azure Synapse, ARM Template
Azure DevOps ‚Äì Repo‚Äôs, CI/CD with multiple services integrated
Programming skills using Java, Python, .Net
Excellent stakeholder management, communication & influencing skills
Understanding trends, industry standards & new concepts in Data & Analytics space
Our Benefits

Besides working in an international environment, you will receive a regularly monthly bonus after your first six months, meal vouchers, a recreation allowance and retail discounts. Additionally, our flexible benefits program will allow you to customize benefits from a selection of 3500 products and service such as gym membership, medical cover, a multi-sports card plus many more.

Our onsite facilities at our Bratislava based office includes a fitness center, canteen, nursery and coffee machines located on every floor.

If you are relocating to Bratislava to join Johnson Controls, you will be eligible to receive a housing allowance to help you setup your new life in Slovakia.

The gross monthly salary for this position starts from 2500 EUR per month, plus a monthly bonus that starts after your first 6 months. Please note this is a minimum salary and our compensation packages are based on your professional experience and qualifications.

Our culture

At Johnson Controls you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting projects in today‚Äôs market. Our hardworking people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, results-oriented, hardworking and above all fun.

We believe that diversity and inclusion matter and make a difference. By embracing the true value of diversity and inclusion, getting comfortable with having crucial conversations, and valuing different perspectives, we will be one of the most desirable places to work.

Job Description:

Showoff is looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join our remote working team. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for analysing the complex business requirements of our clients, designing, coding, testing, maintaining, and supporting our team. You will be actively involved throughout the project lifecycle and work closely with our Solution Architect, Service Delivery Manager and Director of Engineering. The position is based in Ireland, working remotely.

Responsibilities:

Develop RESTful APIs using Ruby on Rails, Node and other technologies
Develop React web applications
Understand and analyse requirements to help define and scope projects
Collaborate with the front-end, back-end and mobile developers
Collaborate with the QA Team
Collaborate with the UI/UX Team
Collaborate with the Commercial Team
Understanding design principles and detailed knowledge of database architectures
Designing tools for systems to meet business needs
Contributes to best practice system and application design
Designing, coding and testing programs and scripts from the agreed specification
Conducting releases to production environments
Contributing ideas and experience to new development solutions
Provide support in development processes and techniques
Qualifications
3+ years of related experience
Experience in‚ÄØRoR
Experience in‚ÄØweb development particularly with React.JS/Next.JS
Experience in‚ÄØHeroku or similar PaaS
Experience working with and integrating 3rd party APIs and libraries.
Experience in protocols related to API Security including Oauth
Experience developing‚ÄØmicroservices
Proficiency in SQL, particularly using Postgres
Professional, precise communication and collaboration skills, particularly in a remote working environment
Good critical thinking, problem-solving and time-management skills
Fluent in spoken and written English
Preferred Experience / Skills
Experience working with an Agile development methodology
Experience with Postman
Experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA/BitBucket)
Experience with Stripe
Experience with Salesforce
Experience with Mulesoft
Experience with AWS
Mobile development experience (native and cross-platform)
Previous experience working in an Agency environment or Consultancy practice.

Benefits at Showoff:

Fully Remote Position with quarterly team in-person meetups
Competitive Salary

About Showoff:

Showoff has grown from 80 sheep and ‚Ç¨4000 to where we are today, an Enterprise Consulting Partner (ECP). We provide an in-house team designed to help from concept to build and provide ongoing support after the work has been done. Our goal is to create lifelong features for our client's business that will give customers a unique, standalone experience, while simultaneously building a platform that will help their company run more efficiently and effectively.

What we do:

We provide an 'art of the possible' around our clients' digital plans and accelerate them above the rest in the ever-growing technological world. Guiding clients to build unique and innovative features that:
Increase customer engagement
Design new revenue streams suited for every customer situation.
Decrease company time - Seamless connectivity and improved workflow will increase company efficiency and reduce operational costs.
Open the floor to new projects and innovation
From start to finish, our team help companies accelerate their projects significantly faster than other traditional methods.

Why clients choose Showoff:
Showoff has reached the level of success today by focusing on three main priorities for each opportunity that arises:
Adapt - Understand a company‚Äôs industry, the need to change and the most efficient way to facilitate their transformation.
React - Create a structured plan that increases the efficiency of your project and time to completion at every step of the way.
Support - Provide support to ensure consistency and reduce any risk to scaling a business.

At Showoff you will get the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment with exposure to an exciting variety of projects and industries. Our hardworking team is passionate about technology and expanding their knowledge and skills. We‚Äôre proud to have an inclusive, diverse and driven team that supports each other to be the best that they can be, delivering consistently top-class products and services to our clients.

How to apply:

To apply, send us:
An up-to-date CV
Cover letter
Examples of your work (App links, code samples, Github link etc)
If you think you are the right person for the job, and for immediate consideration please get in touch with jobs@showoff.ie, referring to the Full Stack Engineer Role.

Please note:
Should you choose to apply for our position, we will contact you to inform you of our recruitment process. If you would like your application to be kept on file for any future potential opportunities, please let us know in your reply.

Showoff is fully compliant with GDPR and you can read more about our privacy policy here: https://bit.ly/ShowoffPolicies. Your shared data will not be disclosed or transferred to a third-party data controller or data processor located outside the EEA unless we have obtained your express consent.

We look forward to working with you.

Description

Hi, want to build out the future of content automation with us?

Storyteq is a Creative Marketing Operations Platform that empowers digital creative leads and marketing leaders, in top global brands and agencies to optimise and scale the way they create and manage digital creative assets. We believe creativity takes time, but creative production shouldn't.

Since 2016 our mission has been to revolutionise the way creative assets are created and managed throughout global organisations. Magic happens when we let technology empower creativity in this way.

Our endless curiosity and relentless commitment to our customers lies at the heart of our approach to solving problems. This common mission is weaved into our values: we take risks (be bold), thrive on change (move fast), and lead with trust (stay familiar).

About The Job

Our Mid-level Backend Engineer positions require true ‚ÄòEngineers‚Äô with Product based mindsets. You will be joining a team of Engineers who come from backgrounds in solving complex software engineering challenges, accustomed to working in a proactive manner, identifying areas for improvement and implementing these effectively.

The role will require you to utilise your knowledge of best-practice software development principles where you can design, develop and implement new features for our SaaS platform, whilst making our product even more scalable and awesome.

Our Tech stack is 'JavaScript Everywhere' meaning we use Node.js for Backend software development. Ideal candidates will demonstrate a core Engineering background with C based languages (think Java, C++, Scala, Python, Go etc), who have recent Node.js experience and are looking to further their career in a forward-thinking Product environment.

As a Mid-level Engineer, you must have a strong foundation in Backend Software Development gained in a Product based environment and are a step away from considering yourself a ‚ÄòSenior‚Äô. We welcome applications at this level as perhaps YOU are our next up and coming superstar‚Ä¶

Your main responsibilities:

Building new features and technological innovations in our Node.js back-end as part of one of our Development Teams
Understand and help define our platform's architecture together with the team
Challenge our product and team members to continuously develop themselves and our product

Besides fun to work with, you...

Have Node.js Development experience - essential (more than connecting an API!)
Possess a deep understanding of modern software engineering design and development principles
Can demonstrate previous experience of backend software engineering using ANY of the following: Java, C++, Python, Go, Scala
Are Experienced with modern JavaScript (ES5/ES6+)
Are great at modelling business domains into data models
Have a good understanding and experience with different database paradigms and when to use them
Have a deep understanding of APIs
You're proactive, result-driven, and excited to work in a fast-growing tech scale-up
You're a team player and like to work together to reach our goals
MUST HAVE gained Software Engineer / Development experience in a SaaS / Product based environment

Also great to have....

Experience with Node frameworks like NestJS or Express
Experience with message queues like RabbitMQ, PubSub or similar

Things we love at Storyteq:

Be entrepreneurial
See and seize opportunities
Take ownership
Focus on impact
Be ambitious
Be organised

Benefits

A role where you can make an impact on important projects for one of Europe‚Äôs fastest growing platforms üöÄ
No chores, but challenges! You will get all the support you need so you can learn, grow and create the best possible results!
A fun culture, with a focus on freedom and ownership.
Flexible schedule & Hybrid work, including a ‚Ç¨50 monthly allowance to cover those extra cost.
An excellent salary and a Pension contribution.
25 days of annual leave, a Well-being Day (it's time to pamper yourself), and a Volunteer Day! üèù
The best Social Friday afternoon drinks, Quarterly team outings and team collaborative sessions.
Excellent tools: High-end Laptop, Monitor, and everything in between!
Free office lunches and endless snacks ü§§
Travel allowance.
Relocation & VISA application support.
Doggo friendly office, so feel free to bring your furry friend! üê∂

Provide responsive support to clients during normal shift hours, when scheduled for early and late shifts, and as identified for on-call or as requested by management. Early/Late shifts and on-call could be required of the qualified Application Analyst staff
Complete all daily tasks and projects
Track time daily

Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 6 billion downloads and over 300 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #2 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google.

The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, having raised over $1B and backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL.

Voodoo is now a team of over 700 employees worldwide, we‚Äôre looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hyper-casual, hybrid-casual, casual, mid-core and blockchain experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Our Core games team is divided into Publishing, Partnership and Internal Studios teams. With over six billion downloads worldwide, we are the largest and most successful mobile gaming publisher in the world. Since the creation of the App Store, only Meta and Google have achieved more downloads, and we are the only European player in the top six.

What will be your main challenges?

We are looking for talents interested in creating something bigger ! To succeed in this role, you will need to have a good understanding of the hyper casual & casual mobile game market. You will support small and high performing teams. Through your work you will develop your skills and help us to deliver fun and entertaining games to millions of people all around the world!

Identifying and documenting core mobile games concepts and mechanics that can be built into something bigger
Designing the game toward engagement: level design, in-game progression, economics
Building metagames that are modular, versatile and revenue generating
Exploring new ways to entertain a hyper casual audience with casual/midcore concepts
Using the extensive game library of Voodoo to understand what motivates a new generation of game player

The role

Drive selection of game concepts to support teams transition from pure Hyper Casual to more complex Puzzle and Battle mobile games:
Analyze game play and users behavior through internal and external models and tools
Deconstruct and analyze mobile games mechanics to come up with relevant and marketable concepts
Build on yours‚Äô or others' ideas and create consistent and comprehensive game designs starting from a core mechanic
Benchmark the market to stay on top of new trends
Support the creation of new Hybrid Casual Games Hits:
Pitch and implement new game ideas and features to the team, through detailed Game Design Documents
Design games from A to Z: gameplay, FTUE, levels, environments, reward systems, difficulty, balancing, etc.
Get involved in all aspects of game development: UI,UX, game design, logic, performance, etc.
Help fine-tune game balancing, pacing and feeling
Support teams production with relevant tools and good ways of working
Improve the workflow (building a better pipeline, creating reusable templates, creating procedural level designs, etc)
Create gameplay prototypes and a database of gameplay concepts that could be used in the future

Profile

At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Game Designer (or App Designer) with Unity experience preferred
Experience with game prototyping (including participating in game jams)
Solid knowledge about Game Design including game mechanics, level design, and UI/UX
Experience with balancing game systems (difficulty, reward, economy, etc) and funnel optimization
Experienced with creating mock-ups and design documents
Experienced in communicating with programmers, leading them through the execution of your designs and giving feedback
Creative problem-solving skills to address a diversity of game design issues every day, including but not limited to gameplay, level, interface, etc
Good level of English (both writing and speaking)
Versatile, can adapt quickly, and move fast

Benefits : competitive salary and other benefits according to the country you reside.

As a software developer engineer in test, your mission will be to ensure that we only deliver highest-quality products to our customers. You will play a crucial role in our success by helping our users have the best possible experience.

Dataiku's platform is built on modern Web technologies (single page webapp with Angular/AngularJS) and integrates with a very large ecosystem of big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, MPP databases, Cloud services, ...).

Our software testing stack is based on python, pytest, selenium, and allure for the integration tests. Our CI is based on Jenkins with intensive usage of AWS‚Äôs features.

At Dataiku, developers are involved in writing part of the automated integration tests together with the QA team.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Help The Team

Coding advanced automated test suites to exercise our applications at all levels
Defining manual testing plans, test strategies and define priorities
Working with the developers to ensure that they deliver testable code
Improving existing test infrastructure and frameworks (virtual machines, containers, auto-provisioning, UI testing, ...)
Mentoring and helping new QA team members
You might be a good fit if:

You have at least 3-4 years of experience as a Software Developer Engineer in Test with a significant part in automation (API and/or UI Testing)
You think collaborating with developers is the key for a good testing strategy
You have worked with at least one Object Oriented language (as Python, Java, C#, or C++)
You discuss choices before implementing them
Bonus points for any of these:

Experience with big data technologies, such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kubernetes
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and GCP
Basic knowledge of machine learning
Benefits:

Ability to have a significant impact on the quality of our product
Ability to work on the latest and greatest data science technologies
Learn everyday and teach others
Startup atmosphere: free food and drinks, international atmosphere, remote first culture, general good times, and smart/friendly people

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

About the opportunity:

Frontiers catalog is growing. Every month we need to handle more journals, articles, and research topics, to process more data and enable new features for our users.

We are looking for a Data Scientist (Graph) Team Lead with experience leading teams, to join our business and manage a Data Team formed by Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

Key Responsibilities
Lead, coach and evolve your team, creating a culture of excellence that will allow them professional growth.
Plan and coordinate the activities for the creation of data products and features that extract value from data in our different systems.

Map business and technical requirements into actionable initiatives, reporting and analyzing results in a timely manner, and learning from any mistakes

Collaborate with other leaders to identify and capitalize on opportunities to leverage new technologies and create novel solutions to our organizations challenges.

Comfortable handling uncertainty in evolving scenarios who can understand priorities and balance them
Strong knowledge of current industry-wide Data Engineering and DS/ML practices, tools, and techniques
Our technical stack is based on GCP, Google BigQuery, Kafka, Databricks, PySpark, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch and therefore knowledge on any of these would be highly beneficial
These are some of the data challenges we are working on and therefore any experience with these would be beneficial:
Knowledge of Neo4j
Knowledge of Cypher queries
Experience working with knowledge graph
Familiarity with Agile framework
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

100% remote working

The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.

This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.

In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.

You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.

You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.

You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.

What you will do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc).
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors
Nice to have / optional:
Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects
We offer
Learning and Development opportunities and budget
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority pass for travel
Flexible working option

At Mastodon gGmbH, we develop free and open-source software that powers the Mastodon platform. We believe that the ‚Äúpublic square‚Äù of the internet cannot belong to a single corporation. Our mission is to build open-source, decentralized social media that gives people back control over their data and their reach.

We're looking to add a DevOps Engineer (m/f/d) to our small team to maintain and streamline the operation of our own Mastodon servers and the official Mastodon resources such as the official website and web push relay services; as well as to improve deployment and scalability options in the Mastodon software along the way.

What you'll be doing:
Building and maintaining highly available production systems
Deploying updates and fixes, and providing Level 2 technical support
Troubleshooting complex production issues, including performance and function issues
Implementing and improving monitoring and alerting
Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats

Tech you'll be working with:
Ruby on Rails, Node.js
PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch
Kubernetes, Helm

To succeed in this role, we think you should be:
Experienced with Kubernetes, Helm and Terraform
Experienced with PostgreSQL
Comfortable with taking the lead and owning the entire DevOps function
A fast decision-maker with attention to detail
A problem-solver and a team player
Have working proficiency in English

We would also love to see:
Experience with Redis and Elasticsearch
Experience running Mastodon is a strong plus!
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Google Cloud, AWS, Exoscale or Hetzner

Who We Are

Focal Systems is the industry leader in retail AI solutions. We are a Silicon Valley based startup that has more than doubled in size every year since inception. Our mission is to automate and optimize brick and mortar retail using deep learning computer vision. We have been deployed at scale with the top retailers in the world. We are looking for smart, creative and passionate people who love to learn, enjoy thinking critically, and want to help build a great and enduring company!

What We Are Looking For

We generate billions of data points every minute that we utilize to help our clients optimize their store operations. As the Data Scientist, you will be responsible for managing our end to end data pipeline from image to insight. Reporting to the CEO and Head of Product, you will work very closely with our Product, Infrastructure and Deep Learning teams.

What You Will Do
Identify data, metrics and analyses needs; Initiate, develop and maintain data pipelines and data models that powers dashboards and data products with outstanding craftsmanship
Synthesize data findings into compelling stories and communicate them throughout Focal Systems
Act as a strategic partner to Head of Product and Focal executives; initiate and execute on data-driven analyses to help prioritize opportunities and provide actionable recommendations
Prototype new analytics & machine learning models that improve both our insights and the product directly
Work to drive new data initiatives, automation of reports, and establish best practices
Work to scale our insights through better systems and automation
Maximize efficiency and productivity through extensive process analysis and interdepartmental collaboration
Design and implement processes and operational procedure around our data pipeline
Analyze and report on performance metrics such as throughput, accuracy and cost for our data operations
Work closely with product & engineering on building out the tools and platforms utilized in our data processing

What You Need To Be Successful
At least a BS degree (MS / PhD degree preferred) in Engineering, Math, or Computer Science with 5+ years relevant experience
Deep understanding of statistics
Proven ability to manage complex data analysis
Excellent communication, presentation and demonstration skills
Experience with data analytics/business intelligence tools
Deep experience with SQL; knowledge of Python strongly preferred
Stable job history with a "go-the-distance" attitude
Uphold our values & mission
Startup mentality, team player and willing to work 40+ hours a week

Why Focal Systems

Strong Values and Mission: We are a tightly-knit team with an ambitious mission and a strong set of core values, which define our approach to business and have successfully guided us since inception.

Exceptional Team: We are a team of hard-working, fun-loving professionals from some of the most eminent universities, research labs, and tech companies of our time. We pride ourselves on recruiting exceptional individuals to help us redefine the state-of-the-art.

Outstanding Partners: We work with 10+ of the largest retailers in the world and have a world-class roster of investors, advisors and partners to support & advise us in our endeavors.

What We Offer

We care deeply about the health, happiness, and wellbeing of all of our employees. We offer:
Competitive Salary & Attractive Stock
Quarterly Team Retreats
Education grants

Description

Hi, want to build out the future of content automation with us?

Storyteq is a Creative Marketing Operations Platform that empowers digital creative leads and marketing leaders, in top global brands and agencies to optimise and scale the way they create and manage digital creative assets. We believe creativity takes time, but creative production shouldn't.

Since 2016 our mission has been to revolutionise the way creative assets are created and managed throughout global organisations. Magic happens when we let technology empower creativity in this way.

Our endless curiosity and relentless commitment to our customers lies at the heart of our approach to solving problems. This common mission is weaved into our values: we take risks (be bold), thrive on change (move fast), and lead with trust (stay familiar).

About The Job

Our Mid-level Fullstack Engineer positions require true ‚ÄòEngineers‚Äô with Product based mindsets. You will be joining a team of Engineers who come from backgrounds in solving complex software engineering challenges, accustomed to working in a proactive manner, identifying areas for improvement and implementing these effectively.

The role will require you to utilise your knowledge of best practise development principles where you can design, develop and implement new features for our SaaS platform, whilst making our product even more scalable and awesome.

Our Tech stack is 'JavaScript Everywhere' meaning we use modern JavaScript technologies like Vue.js for Frontend and Node.js for Backend Engineering tasks. Ideal candidates will demonstrate a core Engineering background with a deep understanding of JavaScript / ES6 technologies.

As a Mid-level Engineer, you must have a strong foundation in Fullstack Software Development gained in a Product based environment and are a step away from considering yourself a ‚ÄòSenior‚Äô. We welcome applications at this level as perhaps YOU are our next up and coming superstar‚Ä¶

Your main responsibilities:

Building new platform features in our Vue.js front-end and Node.js back-end
Building new features for our state-of-the-art Vue.js.-based Template Builder
Working on our After Effects extension and rendering pipeline
Taking our testing workflows to the next level
Scaling up our code architecture and infrastructure

Besides fun to work with, you...

Have proven software engineering experience gained in a Product / SaaS based environment
Are a master of the JavaScript ecosystem
Have experience with Vue.js
Have experience with Node.js
Are familiar with testing and rely on it on a daily basis
Have affinity with rendering technologies (like ffmpeg)
Have a deep understanding of APIs
Have experience with setting up infrastructure to host applications
Like solving complicated problems in a simple way
Care deeply about the product you are building
Don't shy away from a challenge
Are a team player

Things we love at Storyteq:

Be entrepreneurial
See and seize opportunities
Take ownership
Focus on impact
Be ambitious
Be organised

Benefits

Benefits vary from country to country due to local labour laws however all employees receive:

25 days holiday
Annual wellbeing day
Pension contributions
Bank holidays as per local allowances
Ongoing training and development whilst scaling an enterprise grade SaaS solution that is revolutionising the mar-tec space

We are a startup based in Madrid, and the top digital platform for online parking in Europe. We book customers their parking space in the city center, at airports and at train stations, and we do it at an unbeatable price with discounts that reach up to 70% off the original retail price. We also allow our clients to pay the parking meter in Barcelona and Madrid, and soon in many other European cities. We currently have more than 1 million users and we operate in 8 countries and more than 240 cities.

Our mission is not only to digitize the world of parking, but also to offer everyone at Parclick an incredible opportunity to work and learn at a proper start-up with brilliant colleagues and continuous challenges.

We are looking for a B2B Business Developer Assistant to join our Partnership team. The B2B and Partnership department together with the trade marketing department focuses its efforts on helping those companies willing to add value to their products or services by reselling our products. The channel that gives us the highest satisfaction is certainly B2B and B2B2C, and we achieve it through various technological solutions.
Our most faithful partners are companies operating in the tourism and hotel sectors. But that's not all. Opportunities arise in the market every day, and our job is to analyze and value them on the basis of an opportunity-cost approach. The Partnership department at Parclick will help partners achieve their business goals and, at the same time position our products on the market, making Parclick the most successful brand in its sector.

Responsibilities

Lead, structure and execute projects with a high level of ownership and freedom with a strong focus on success.
Managing existent partners portfolio in Parclick‚Äôs B2B markets of action through customer care (phone calls, email or in person if needed).
Identify and build long lasting relationships with strategic partners.
Developing existing and new distribution channels.
Analyze business opportunities and risks, conducting market researches and lead qualification/calling.
Prospecting new business opportunities/partners to grow in the events area.
Independently managing partners from lead generation to contract signature.
Prospect new possible partners or business segments by actively looking for new opportunities.
Participating in events and fairs as a Parclick Ambassador.
Coordinate, manage and solve partners issues.
Content generation.

Qualifications
We‚Äôre looking for a candidate with a positive and proactive attitude.
You have the capacity to work independently although always surrounded by your colleagues.
2 or more years of sales experience.
Fluent Spanish speaker. Good working knowledge of Spanish and English.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Outstanding communication, negotiation and influencing skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and confidence is approaching and discussing solutions and products with strangers.
Able to multitask.
Ability to work to targets and KPI‚Äôs and self-monitor own performance.
Analytical and strategic planning skills.
International and multicultural perspective.
Entrepreneurial mindset.
Availability to travel.

We highly Value
French and/or Italian as a second language will be highly valued.
Previous experiences in a b2b environment prospecting and/or managing business accounts.
Previous experience with a CRM.
Previous experience in marketing and designing tools.
Knowledge of the parking and tourism industry.
Ability to get to know people, build and maintain meaningful professional relationships.
A results-oriented approach to work.
This job is 100% remote but it will be highly valued if you are based in Barcelona or Madrid.

We offer:
Flexible schedule.
Competitive salary based on experience and a bonus based on results.
Remote work.
The chance to work in a motivating and open environment with talented colleagues that you can learn a lot from.
5 days available to attend training and seminars of your choice in the company.
Company culture based on open communication‚Äî everybody has the chance to contribute and take part in the conversation.
25 Days of paid vacation.

If you think you are a good match for this position and our company, send us your application now! We look forward to hearing from you. We will get back to you as soon as possible with extra details and questions. Further information will be addressed in an interview.

From ideas to impact
We are a global digital business services organization with a mission to improve the way people and companies work. Forever. Our Consulting, Delivery and Learning teams design and deliver transformational digital products and experiences that add value to our clients‚Äô businesses and to their customers‚Äô lives.
Every day, across the world, our teams are pioneering faster, better ways to bring our client‚Äôs most exciting ideas to life.

Would you agree that discovering the unexpected is much more important than confirm what is already known?
If you are intellectually curious mind with strong analytical skills, then you might be just who we‚Äôre looking for: Quality Assurance Automation Engineer to help us shape Emergn‚Äôs exciting future and play an important role in our growth.

We want you to help us delivering great digital products and experiences:
Working as part of an agile team following Value, Flow, Quality guideline principles and practices to provide business value to our customers.
Play significant role in creating and maintaining test suites.
Provide technical support and participate in development of new solutions, following Agile and Scrum best practices.
Perform manual testing as well as craft automatic testing.
Participate in sprint planning meetings ‚Äì gather information about requirements and translate functional documentation into Test sets
.
This job might be for you if you have:
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Knowledge of black-box test design techniques.
Experience with Version Control Systems such as Git, Subversion.
Knowledge of basic SQL and Relational Databases.
Experience with web automated testing using frameworks and tools such as Protractor, WebDriver.IO, Cucumber, Jasmine or Cypress.
REST API testing experience.
Good development skills using JavaScript / TypeScript
Good communication skills in English.

You might also have:
Experience in creating testing strategy planning; test plan development.

We offer:
Health insurance and dental
Life insurance
Extra holidays
Meal allowance and phone allowance
Work within a dynamic international team of experts
Excellent opportunity for personal and professional development
Comfortable office in Porto and flexible working hours
Ability to work from home and all the tools you‚Äôll need for work
Ability to work with modern technologies
Huge catalog of educational programs, the possibility of training and certification at the expense of the company
Friendly environment

The best part:
We help some of the world‚Äôs most respected businesses‚Äîincluding Fortune 500, FTSE 100 and Global 2000 companies develop and deliver their most promising ideas into valuable digital products and customer experiences faster. Emergn offers product innovation, enterprise transformation, experience design, product development, intelligent automation, and data and analytics capabilities. Through our educational platform VFQ, the industry‚Äôs only work-based learning approach to scaled digital transformation, we help global enterprises and individual learners alike build agility into their way of working and deliver value at pace.
With us, you‚Äôre a part of a diverse international community of friendly, supportive experts, working and sharing without borders.
Here, you can push boundaries through challenging and varied work for some of the world‚Äôs most respected international businesses
You‚Äôll get to work with the latest technologies and innovative working practices through our VFQ philosophy and culture of continuous learning.

Work where you‚Äôll make an impact every day.
Join us today!

job_title: Software Engineer Data Preparation - Remote Germany
description:
Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 1,000+ employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we‚Äôve set out to build the future of AI.

As enterprises worldwide become more and more invested in the cloud, Dataiku looks to expand its services and offerings to adapt to rapidly shifting customer needs. Dataiku brings together Big Data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with user-friendly visual interfaces or code.

To help us fulfill this mission, we are looking for a talented full-stack software engineer to work on the Data preparation part of Dataiku and other core features of the platform. Our current technical stack is based on a mix of Java, Javascript and Python.

The Mission Of The Designer & OPALS Teams Is To Maintain And Improve The Core Features Of Dataiku That Are Dedicated To Business Analysts & Developers, Such As

Data preparation & integration: this includes reading from and writing to Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Azure Synapse, and processing data using the latest processing engines: Spark on K8s, SQL with UDFs
SQL workbench & Jupyter notebooks
Integration with IDEs
Help and onboarding experience - Plugins infrastructure
Automation & public REST APIs

What You Will Be Doing

Support new databases capabilities to read/write or process data faster
Optimize our layout engine to be able to render flows of 1000 datasets faster
Improve our help system to make it smarter
Bring spatial joins and isochrone computing to the platform
Improve dataset upload experience using A/B testing
Add support for graphically explain plans in our SQL workbench

You Are The Ideal Recruit If

You have experience in software development and are interested in data processing.
You are "customer-oriented" you want to understand how the product is used and solve actual customer problems
You know, Data science is 80% preparing data and 20% complaining about preparing data.
You are curious about working '≈ìunder the hood' and want to learn how things are built.
You have firsthand experience (either professional or personal) in building a real product.
You are humble and kind.
You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty.
Dataiku's culture is right for you if:

You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits.
You need autonomy to thrive - we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines.
You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more.
You like feeling cared about - watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week .
You care about giving back - it's what our Ikig.AI program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing .

If you want to learn more about our hiring process, you can read this article about our engineering hiring philosophy .

About Dataiku

Dataiku is the platform for Everyday AI, systemizing the use of data for exceptional business results. By making the use of data and AI an everyday behavior, Dataiku unlocks the creativity within individual employees to power collective success at companies of all sizes and across all industries. Don‚Äôt get us wrong: we are a tech company building software. Our culture is even pretty geeky! But our driving force is and will always remain people, starting with ours. We consider our employees to be our most precious asset, and we are committed to ensuring that each of them gets the most rewarding, enjoyable, and memorable work experience with us. Fly over to Instagram to learn more about our #dataikulife.

Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.

This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.

In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.

You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.

You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.

You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.

What you will do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc).
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors
Nice to have / optional:
Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects
We offer
Learning and Development opportunities and budget
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority pass for travel
Flexible working option

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

#stack

Description

At Blueground, our vision is to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. For us, that means ensuring our guests have the peace of mind, flexibility & confidence they need to explore life‚Äôs latest adventure.

We‚Äôve grown a lot since our founding in 2013, having raised more than $258m+ in funding, to date -- and that‚Äôs just the beginning. We‚Äôre now hosting guests in more than 11,000 homes in 30 cities around the world (and growing!), with an aim to hit 50 cities by 2025.

Our vision comes to life through our ways of working. For our 1,100+ member team located across 16 countries, we‚Äôve created a culture of collaboration, inclusiveness, and opportunity.

We believe our people should have the power to choose their preferred way to work. Depending on the role‚Äôs requirements, team members can choose to work full time in one of our offices, work fully remote, or choose a hybrid model between the two.

We are driven by our core values. To our team, Time is our most important resource. Excellence isn‚Äôt simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our guests and colleagues. Our relationships are built around Transparency, which builds trust and improves communication.

We‚Äôre shaping the future of living, and we want you to be part of that journey.

We are looking for a talented Software Development Engineer in Test to join our Engineering team in Athens and work on our business critical backend services.

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on testability, robustness and performance on our products with a well established development methodology, a robust CI pipeline, solid engineering practices and challenging requirements (you won't get bored).

Our Stack

Kotlin | Javascript | Typescript
Spring Boot
Node
Postgres | MongoDB | Redis
RabbitMq
Spock | Jest | Cypress.io
Rest | GraphQL
Docker | AWS | k8s on EKS
Serverless

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog.

What You'll Do

Setting up, maintaining and performing test automation frameworks on multiple application platforms, such as Mobile and Web and building test scenarios and acceptance tests
Understanding feature specifications, system requirements and product objectives to create and execute test cases
Analyzing and disintegrating software system and coordinating with other teams to enhance the overall design
Researching test tools, frameworks and trends in order to upgrade existing processes
Be responsible for the final quality on production release

What To Expect

To work in agile, cross functional, DevOps enabled teams
To work with a product manager and an engineer in test
To work on functional and non functional testing
To work on performance
To test challenging integration scenarios
To enjoy some quality engineering
A rapidly growing company
Cool colleagues :)

Interview process

Behavioral Dialogue with Talent Acquisition Team (30m)
Live Coding: Evaluating Coding Skills (90m)
Tech Dialogue: Computer Science Fundamentals (2 hours)
Executive Dialogue (optional - L3+): Leadership and Power Skills (30m)

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest testing trends. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and testing practises as well as core concepts of your primary language (e.g. Javascript or Python). We will also try to tackle some real-world testing problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.

Requirements

Industry experience in software testing
Strong CS background
Strong skills in one of Javascript, Python, Ruby, Groovy
Good knowledge of at least one testing framework (cypress.io, webdriverIO, playwright)
Knowing your way around databases
Testing mindset and an eye for clean code
Really comfortable with Git
Excellent communication in English
BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
Bonus: experience with Docker / Kubernetes
Bonus: knowing your way around the *nix shell
Bonus: experience with CI Solutions (Jenkins, Github Actions, etc)

Benefits

Competitive salary & annual performance bonus
Blueground Stock Option Plan
Flexible paid time off
Group Health Insurance program
Enhanced parental leave
Dynamic working environment with talented people
Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program
Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

For more information on Blueground, visit us at www.theblueground.com. To keep up with Blueground news, follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram and Tik Tok!

Job Description

Project Managers are the primary point of contact for our clients from project initiation through to closeout. The Project Manager is responsible for ensuring that projects are carried out to the best possible standards, within relevant timelines, at an acceptable cost and in line with overall company objectives, while meeting client requirements for deliverables. They are responsible for setting and meeting client expectations and communicating project progress to all the stakeholders in the project ‚Äì the client, sales and the operations team.

Remote, work from home opportunity! Monday through Friday, regular business hours.

Responsibilities

Provide exceptional service.
Work with sales to help plan projects and ensure they are scoped in a cost effective manner.
Attend transition/kick-off calls.
Oversee status calls with clients and internal resources.
Take responsibility for all aspects of an individual project once the contract is agreed.
Deliver projects on time and to budget, and to client satisfaction.
Provide pricing input related to any project requirements.
Provide project specific reporting as required by the client and internal stakeholders.
Develop relationships with appropriate client representatives.
Work with the Project Office Team to ensure that project documentation is maintained.
Ensure that project knowledge is shared with other members of the team
Ensure all project financials are appropriately managed, forecasted and invoiced.

Further role Duties

Essential Function: Successfully manage complex concurrent projects from project win to completion.
Desired Result: Deliver projects which meet or exceed client expectations.
Essential Function: Provide complete and timely communications to KLDiscovery clients ensuring that at all levels of the client organisation, the project status is understood.
Desired Result: Client expectations are understood by KLDiscovery and the client has an appropriate understanding of project status and futures.
Essential Function: Provide appropriate work direction to all internal KLDiscovery personnel assigned to execute the project.
Desired Result: KLDiscovery staff can deliver projects which meet or exceed client expectations.
Essential Function: Act as a liaison between internal KLDiscovery personnel and KLDiscovery‚Äôs client to facilitate successful project completion.
Desired Result: Information is accurately communicated in a manner that each party can understand.
Essential Function: Facilitate project meetings and internal communication between KLDiscovery staff to ensure projects are completed correctly and on time.
Desired Result: Takes ownership and ensures timely completion of action items to maintain project schedule.
Essential Function: Carry out all appropriate processes and procedures to ensure correct forecasting of revenue and invoicing of client project.
Desired Result: Correct financial forecast and invoices are made to the appropriate stakeholders.

Experience

Significant project management experience within Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) where this has involved extension and ongoing liaison (face to face, phone and email) with external clients.
Hands on experience with RELATIVITY e-Discovery review platform.
Proven ability to lead multiple projects and multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Must have previous experience of facilitating meetings and following complex/detailed processes.
Legal/industry knowledge or experience is essential.
High degree of interpersonal sensitivity to allow building of relationships with experienced, qualified staff and clients.
Solid written and verbal communication skills ‚Äì ability to communicate with individuals at all levels.
Strong ability to work autonomously; identifies and presents solutions; confident decision making ability.
Strong attention to detail.
Technical aptitude and financial appreciation.
Ability to work effectively within a team environment.
Degree or equivalent qualification preferred.
Fluent English is required. Fluency in German would be highly advantageous

What We Offer

A friendly and welcoming team-oriented environment
Opportunities for career advancement and growth
Paid benefits

KLDiscovery Culture

We Seek Team Members Who Are

Entrepreneurs at heart, we are a customer first team sharing one goal and one vision.

Humble - No one is above another; we all work together to meet our clients‚Äô needs and we acknowledge our own weaknesses;
Hungry - We all are driven internally to be successful and to continually expand our contribution and impact;
Smart - We use emotional intelligence when working with one another and with clients.

Our culture shapes our actions, our products, and the relationships we forge with our customers. It helps us stand out in an ever-increasing crowd of providers. It is special and it is unique. It is KLDiscovery.

Company Overview

At Silent Eight, we develop our own AI-based products to combat financial crimes that enable things like money laundering, the financing of terrorism, and systemic corruption. We're a leading RegTech firm working with large international financial institutions such as Standard Chartered Bank and HSBC. Join us and help make the world a safer place!

Job Overview:

As a Solutions Engineer you'll play a pivotal role being the technical face of the company in pre-sales engagements. Your role will include providing compelling product demonstrations, giving Technical Deep Dive presentations into the inner workings of the product, running Proof-of-Concepts, building technical champions, and gathering technical requirements for implementation. You will also participate in understanding client needs and data, initial technical setup of our solution, solve compatibility issues, interpret, tune and present results to customer

Location: Remote with possibility of 40-60% travel to customer locations.

Key Duties:
Perform product demonstrations that engage the audience and explain by showing how our product works.
Initial technical setup of our solution
Understanding client needs and data
Solve compatibility issues
Interpret, tune and present results to customer
Design and deliver new workflows, tests, and POCs for clients, and make recommendations for new use cases.
Lead Technical Workshops with prospective customers on topics such as our Machine Learning approach, Integrations, Architecture and Security.
Present detailed, data-driven reports to the prospects, explaining insights and compelling use cases.
Work with prospects to understand their technology stack and IT business processes to facilitate a clean hand-off to the post-sales CS Team
Work alongside Account Executives to drive the deal strategy, helping address any knowledge gaps and build trust with the prospect all the way until they are a customer
Help us improve current processes, making presentations, demos, and business case presentations more repeatable, scalable, and more compelling.

Modern Technology Stack:
Work methodology: Scrum
Main technologies: Python 3, SQL,
Tools used: Python (Pandas, Jupyter notebooks, regex, JSON), PySpark. docker, Unix, SQL
Build server: Jenkins, Git
Code reviews: GitLab
Issue tracking tool: Jira
Knowledge repository: Confluence, Google Drive
Operating system: Linux

Requirements:
5+ Years experience in a pre-sales and/or post-sales customer facing technical role.
Experience in any of the following - Data Engineering, Data Quality, Data Management, Data Science, Machine Learning, MlOPS
Ability to travel 40-60% to client sites
Ability to setup and solve issues related to unix and python environment setup.
Strong Presentation and Communication skills
A solid understanding of Data Engineering and Data Science
Ability to communicate deep technical concepts to a non or semi-technical audience, while also being able to hold your own with a strong technical audience
Practical usage of regular expressions

Job Remuneration:
Salary: 11 000 - 18 000 net PLN/month (B2B)
Employment Type: B2B
Employee stock options
Paid days to balance your work and life in a way that suits you best
Location: Fully remote forever (with a possibility to work from a co-working office)
Career growth: Promotion and great development opportunities within the organization

Our culture

You will be co-creating our business solutions

We believe that your feedback allows us to create the best solutions as well as adjusted work culture. You will have a real impact on the growth of the company and the product we develop.

Experienced Team

We aren't your run-of-the-mill tech start-up. At Silent Eight, everyone is a leader in their own field with perspective and experience shared across teams and departments.

Development-centric

Because learning never ends, we empower our employees to invest in themselves. We provide a range of resources such as paid Development Days, in-house training, lunch-and-learns, etc. to make sure our employees are continuing to grow each day.

Team building events

We know that our success is only possible if we work together as a team. We are a group of passionate individuals united by a common mission. Therefore we like to meet together regularly to connect not just as coworkers, but as human beings, whether it's at an offsite in Dubai or a weekly "Tea Time" to catch up.

100% remote work forever

We are not new to working remotely. In fact, we've been doing it since 2013 and we know how to make you feel supported, connected, and included. We believe that the freedom to choose where you work from is important to finding the journey that is right for you.

Don't wait! Join our team today!

Silent Eight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local law.
